TEXT.TITLE: BP CUTS NORTH SEA PROPANE PRICE, BUTANE UNCHANGED
TEXT.BODY: British Petroleum LP Gas International said it cut its North Sea LPG (Liquified Petroleum Gas) posted price for propane to 95 dlrs from 110 dlrs a tonne, effective June 1. The move follows a similar cut to 92 from 108 dlrs a tonne announced by Shell U.K. Ltd Friday, also fob North Sea terminals and effective June 1 until further notice. Both companies left their butane prices unchanged at 123 dlrs a tonne. A BP statement said its cut came "as a result of a price review occasioned by substantial changes in the LPG market." BP last lowered its posted propane price from 175 dlrs a tonne on March 1, and Shell U.K.'s last change was from 113 dlrs May 1. REUTER
